title: Desert National Park
short_description: A vast expanse of Thar Desert ecosystem, the last refuge of the critically endangered Great Indian Bustard.
long_description: Desert National Park, situated in the Indian state of Rajasthan near the towns of Jaisalmer and Barmer, is a perfect example of the ecosystem of the Thar Desert. Covering an area of 3162 km2, it is one of the largest national parks in India. The park is characterized by sand dunes, craggy rocks, and salt lake bottoms. It is famous for being the habitat of the Great Indian Bustard, a magnificent bird nearing extinction. The park also hosts dinosaur fossils dating back 180 million years at the Akal Wood Fossil Park.
wildlife_significance: Crucial habitat for the Great Indian Bustard (state bird of Rajasthan).
major_experiences: Camel Ride in Sam Sand Dunes
guides_and_tips: Sudasari enclosure is the best place to spot the Bustard. Requires permit from Jaisalmer office.
how_to_reach: By Air: Jaisalmer Airport (40 km). By Rail: Jaisalmer (40 km). By Road: 1 hour drive from Jaisalmer city.
permits_and_fees: Permit required for core areas. Available at Forest Office Jaisalmer.
conservation_notes: Project Great Indian Bustard is active here. High tension wires are being removed/flagged to save birds.
sample_itinerary: Day 1: Arrive Jaisalmer. Visit Fort. Evening Sam Sand Dunes camel ride. Camp stay. Day 2: Morning Jeep Safari to Sudasari (Bustard spot). Visit Akal Wood Fossil Park. Return.
safety_tips: Extreme heat in summer. Carry plenty of water. Beware of vipers in sand.

pricing_metadata.disclaimer: Desert camp prices fluctuate wildly in peak season.
